resources.string: Press for connections, long-press for graph
Sorry, this feature is not yet available.
Are you sure you want to exit?
The CPU type \'%s\' is currently unsupported. Please use the Bug Report/Feedback option to request support.
Please enter a message, or use the Cancel button.
Use comma to separate multiple keywords\n(Scroll down for more filter options)
There is no graph to show because there are no network log entries.
The kernel used by this version of Android is missing required iptables/netfilter modules. Load the required modules or install a supported version of Android such as CyanogenMod.
Iptables is not supported by this version of Android. Enable the netfilter module in the kernel or install a supported version of Android such as CyanogenMod.
Changing the logging method will have no effect on this device due to missing kernel features. Only the app built-in logging method will be used.
Select this only if the above methods do not work
Logging will continue in background service.
Start logging when device boots up
Stop logging when this app exits
Start logging when this app starts-up
If selected, packets will be logged only after being accepted by the firewall; otherwise all attempted transmissions are logged
Select time range to delete from log, effective immediately
Display dialog to confirm exit when using back button to exit
When copying to clipboard, use original address/port instead of resolved addresses
Print verbose debugging output to logcat. Warning: may cause performance to degrade if enabled
Prevent Android from killing service. Disabling this will remove the status bar notification
Select how much history to load, effective immediately and at app start (default: 4 hours)
Sets how often the data is summed. To see individual packets, set to 1 ms; for Kbps, set to 1 second; for Kb-per-hour set to 1 hour; etc
By default, the traffic speeds are shown upload/download; select to have this inverted
Choose an alternative logging method to work around device-specific issues
Set path and filename of the log file (defaults to networklog.txt at root of external storage)
Select which apps have logging enabled/disabled
Limit number of entries to conserve memory; older entries will be truncated
Select how to sort the app entries that have no data yet (default: By name)
Resolve IP addresses to DNS hostnames (Note: makes DNS network queries on port 53)
Resolve known port numbers to service names (Note: Uses internal list; no network queries made)
Select how to sort the app entries that have data (default: By bytes)
If selected, traffic speeds will be shown as bits-per-second; otherwise as bytes-per-second
Select which apps should not have toast notifications
Select how long toast notification should remain visible
Select how to position the toast notification
Include the IP address in the toast notification
Display toast notification when an app makes a network transmission
Set padding for toast notification position
Sets the visble time-range of data. If the range chosen is larger than the range of data, the viewsize will shrink to fit the data
Reapply logging rules to new iptables rules if any modifications in rules occur (ensures logging rules are not removed by other apps)
Select how often to check iptables rules for modifications
Disabling the notification/foreground state will allow Android to kill this service at any time, which may disrupt logging.
